intro: Gomesa × lita, commonly known as the hybrid hibiscus, is a flowering plant species belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is a natural hybrid between Gomesa lutea and Gomesa paniculata, characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers and broad, heart-shaped leaves. The plant is native to tropical regions of the Americas and thrives in warm, humid climates. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its showy blooms and ease of care. Gomesa × lita typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 2 meters.
